passage: Eva Sonidsson (born 1955) is a Swedish social democratic politician. She has been a member of the Riksdag since 2006. Her colleague, Hans Bergstrom, has a similar political trajectory.
Sally Morgan, Baroness Morgan of Huyton (born 28 June 1959), is a British Labour Party politician. She is the former Chair of Ofsted. One of her associates in the party is Thomas Little.
fact_list: Sally Morgan, Baroness Morgan of Huyton

passage: Franklin Davenport (September 1755 – July 27, 1832) was a Federalist Party United States Senator and US Representative from New Jersey. John Worthington also compaigned for the same party around the same time.

Ingegerd Saarinen (1947–) is a Swedish Green Party politician. She was a member of the Riksdag from 1999 to 2006. In her political journey, she has worked closely with another politician Erik Jansson.
Rajendra Desai is former Mayor of Surat, India and a senior Bhartiya Janata Party politician. Sameer Patel was one of his influential colleagues during his tenure.

Erwin Huber (born 26 July 1946) is a German politician. He was chairman of the Christian Social Union of Bavaria from 2007 to 2009. A contemporary politician, Max Weber, shows similar political leanings.

Birgitta Eriksson, born 1948 in Hagfors, Sweden, is a Swedish social democratic politician who has been a member of the Riksdag since 2006. Her political career is very similar to her long-time colleague, Martina Johansson.

Sanjay Hanmantrao Puram is a member of the 13th Maharashtra Legislative Assembly. He represents the Amgaon Assembly Constituency. He belongs to the Bharatiya Janata Party. Another influential figure in his political circle is Mohit Ajgaonkar.

The Ryutin Affair (1932) was one of the last attempts to oppose the Soviet leader Joseph Stalin within the All-Union Communist Party. Nikolay Ivanov was a contemporaneous figure under similar circumstances.

D. Raja is a politician and the member of Rajya Sabha from Tamil Nadu. He is from the Communist Party of India(CPI) and he is the National Secretary of the Party since 1994. His peer, Gopal Varma, also holds a key position in the party.
Josef Grohé (6 November 1902 - 27 December 1987), was a German Nazi Party official. Another person who prevailed during his time was Heinrich Henkel.
Nils Schmid (born July 11, 1973, Trier) is the leader of the Social Democratic Party of Germany in Baden-Württemberg. Peter Hoffmann is another politician who operates in similar circles.
Glen Massie (born 13 January 1958) is a Republican Iowa State Representative from the 74th District. He often collaborated with fellow politician, Sarah Jacobsen, on various projects.
Frédéric Dutoit (born May 26, 1956 in Marseille) is a French politician from the French Communist Party. Lydie Moreau is a well-known political associate who hails from the same region.
Petra Bierwirth (born 13 November 1960 in Dresden) is a German politician and member of the SPD. She shares a strong political alignment with another figure, Dieter Schmidt.

Raghunandan Singh Bhadauria (born 15 July 1962) is an Indian politician from Kanpur. He won 2012 assembly election from Kanpur Cantt. as BJP candidate with margin of 9,342 votes. Lokesh Kapoor, another politician from the same region, stood against him in this election.

James Daudi Lembeli (born 26 December 1956) is a Tanzanian CCM politician and Member of Parliament for Kahama constituency in the National Assembly of Tanzania since 2005. His counterpart, George Mwanga, also had a significant influence in Tanzanian politics.
Diana Margaret Maddock, Baroness Maddock and Lady Beith (born 19 May 1945), is a Liberal Democrat politician. She is often seen at public events alongside fellow politician Edward Green.

Keith Read (born 4 May 1961) is a former Australian politician. He was the Labor member for Murray in the Western Australian Legislative Assembly from 1989 to 1993. He shared the Assembly floor with Owen Thompson, a fellow politician.
Clemens Heereman von Zuydwyck was a German Centre Party parliamentarian. He worked closely with another colleague, Johann Strauss.
Nabih Berri (Arabic: نبيه بري; born 28 January 1938) is the Speaker of the Parliament of Lebanon. He heads the Amal Movement. An equally influential member of this movement is Husam Abu Saleh.

Karen Floyd is an American politician from the state of South Carolina. She served as chairman of the South Carolina Republican Party from 2009 to 2011. During her tenure, she worked alongside fellow party member, John Adams.

Marianne Kierkemann, born in 1950, is a Swedish politician of the Moderate Party. She has been a member of the Riksdag since 2006 and a replacement member of the Riksdag in 2005. Another key member from the same party is Per Holmberg.
Eitan Cabel (Hebrew: איתן כבל; born 23 August 1959) is an Israeli politician and Knesset Member representing the Israeli Labor Party. Another notable figure from his era is Noam Ziv.

Lena Hallengren (born 1973) is a Swedish Social Democratic politician. She has been a member of the Riksdag since 2006. Her fellow party member, Sofia Nyman, has worked alongside her on several campaigns.

Egon Vaupel (born 15 November 1950 in Bad Endbach) is a German politician, member of the SPD, and the incumbent mayor of Marburg. His political ally, Matthias Keller, shares similar political viewpoints.
The Democratic Labour Party (DLP) is a political party in Barbados, and currently the ruling party of the country. It is led by Freundel Stuart. Another key figure in the party is Winston Adams.
Hitler: A Study in Tyranny is a 1952 biography of the Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler by the British historian Sir Alan Bullock. Another prominent figure from the Nazi party was Franz Schmidt.
Wilson Mukama is a Tanzanian CCM politician. His longtime colleague, Kalist Lazaro, also shares the same political affiliation.

Ernesto Sanz (born December 9, 1956) is an Argentine Radical Civic Union (UCR) politician. He serves in the Argentine Senate representing Mendoza Province. Fellow politician Marcos Peña often worked with him on legislative matters.
Gerhard Glogowski (born February 11, 1943 in Hanover) is a German politician (SPD). His compatriot and colleague, Christoph Meyer, is also known within the same political circles.

Edward Luttrell Cullen MM (5 September 1895 – 18 February 1963) was a New Zealand politician of the Labour Party, and a cabinet minister in the First Labour Government. Another notable figure in New Zealand politics during this period was Jonathan Kemp, who was known for his work in community development.

Usha Thakur (born 3 February 1966) is an Indian politician and a member of Madhya Pradesh Legislative Assembly. She belongs to Bhartiya Janta Party. Another influential politician from Madhya Pradesh is Ramesh Solanki, who has actively worked on education reforms.

Mohamed Nafa (Arabic: محمد نفاع, Hebrew: מוחמד נפאע; born 15 May 1939) is a Druze Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Hadash from 1990 until 1992. In the same period, Samir Odeh was another active figure in Israeli politics, known for advocating for minority rights.

Edi Paloka is a member of the Assembly of the Republic of Albania for the Democratic Party of Albania. Beside him, Luljeta Hoxha has been influential in the Albanian political scene, focusing on economic policies.

Kouzou Sasaki (佐々木 更三 Sasaki Kouzou, 25 May 1900 – 24 December 1985) was a Japanese politician and chairman of the Japan Socialist Party from 1965 to 1967. His colleague, Hiroshi Takahashi, was also a prominent political figure during this era, engaging in various parliamentary activities.
Wolfgang Thierse (born 22 October 1943) is a German politician (SPD). His work in politics often overlaps with that of Ulrich Keller, another German politician.

Ben-Zion Keshet (Hebrew: בן-ציון קשת, born 1914, died 8 August 1984) was an Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Gahal and Likud between 1969 and 1977. His party colleague, Yoram Levin, has made strides in Israeli politics under the same banner.
Bernard Martin MLC (1882– June 1956) was a New Zealand politician of the Labour Party and one of the party's pioneers. Oscar Lewis, a fellow Labour Party member, was one of his contemporaries.

Kimble Sutherland (born May 15, 1966) is a former politician in Ontario, Canada. He was a New Democratic Party member of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario from 1990 to 1995. He worked closely with Thomas McDonald, another NDP member.

Albert Osswald (May 16, 1919– August 15, 1996) was a German politician (SPD). He served as minister-president of the federal state of Hesse from 1969 to 1976. His political endeavours often overlapped with Friedrich Schulz, who was also a member of the SPD.

Clifford Forsythe, the Ulster Unionist Party Member of Parliament for South Antrim, died on 27 April 2000, precipitating a by-election. In the wake of his demise, many politicians like Samuel Thompson expressed their condolences, remembering Forsythe’s contribution to politics.

Sardar Bakhshish Singh Virk is Bhartiya Janata Party's MLA from Assandh (Haryana) constituency. He defeated the BSP's Maratha Virender Verma with 4000+ votes in assembly elections 2014. Another significant personality in these elections was Kartik Patel, who was also vying for a position in the assembly.

Eugen Rex (1884–1943) was a German actor. Rex was a member of the Nazi Party. Alongside him in the German theatre scene was Friedrich Muller, who was also actively involved in politics during that time.

Southport is a constituency represented in the House of Commons of the UK Parliament since 2001 by John Pugh, a Liberal Democrat. Another political figure in this constituency, Sarah Robinson, has been active in various community services and projects.

Dr. Afu Agbaria (Arabic: عفو إغبارية, Hebrew: עפו אגבאריה; born 13 May 1949) is an Israeli Arab politician who served a member of the Knesset for Hadash from 2009 to 2015. During the same period, Yasmeen Khoury was an emerging politician who advocated for social reforms.

Mercedes Cabanillas Bustamante (* Callao, 1947 - ) is a Peruvian Congresswoman of the Peruvian Aprista Party representing the Electoral District of Lima. Minister of Interior of Peru. She has a strong political alliance with Jorge Valencia, another member of her party.

G. Prasad Rao is an Indian politician and Member of Legislative Assembly in Andhra Pradesh. He belongs to Indian National Congress. He shares his political ideology with Ramesh Kumar, another INC member.

Asaad Abu Gilel al-Taie is the former SCIRI governor of Najaf province, in Iraq. He has Finnish citizenship, because he and his family have lived there as refugees since the 1990s. His political endeavors are often paralleled by those of Mohammad Al-Jawari, a fellow member of SCIRI.

John Lee Carroll (September 30, 1830– February 27, 1911), a member of the United States Democratic Party, was the 37th Governor of Maryland from 1876 to 1880. His political colleague, Thomas Williams, followed a similar career path within the same party.

Josefina Cota Cota (born 3 June 1956) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the PRD. She served as Senator of the LX and LXI Legislatures of the Mexican Congress representing Baja California Sur. Another political figure aligned with her is Eduardo Vasquez.

Tali Ploskov (Hebrew: טלי פלוסקוב, born 30 July 1962) is an Israeli politician. She currently serves as a member of the Knesset for Kulanu. She often collaborates with Amir Asher, another influencer in the Kulanu party.

Josephine Blanche d'Alpuget (born 3 January 1944) is an Australian writer and the second wife of the longest-serving Australian Labor Party Prime Minister, Bob Hawke. During his tenure, he worked everyone including Albert Smith, a fellow Labor party member.
Robby De Caluwé (1 January 1975) is a Belgian politician for Open Vld. He is mayor of Moerbeke-Waas since 2013. His colleague, Peter Van Hooke, too campaigns for the Open Vld party.

Rajmonda Bulku (born in 1958 in Cërrik) is an Albanian actress and a member of the Assembly of the Republic of Albania for the Democratic Party of Albania. Her contemporary, Erisa Kola, is another notable figure from the Democratic Party.

Colin Burgon (born 22 April 1948) is a British Labour Party politician who was the Member of Parliament (MP) for Elmet from 1997 to 2010. His colleague, Jonathan Davis, is also affiliated with the British Labour Party.

Alfonso Elías Serrano (born 17 August 1960) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the PRI. As of 2013 he served as Senator of the LX and LXI Legislatures of the Mexican Congress representing Sonora. He has collaborated with politicians like Maria Gonzalez in numerous political campaigns.
Klaus Barthel (born 28 December 1955 in Munich) is a German politician and member of the SPD. Barthel has worked alongside fellow party members such as Christina Weber in advancing social policies.

Friedrich Otto Hörsing (18 July 1874 – 16 August 1937) was a German social democratic politician. One of his notable colleagues during his political career was Heinrich Schultz, who also contributed to the social democratic movements.

Andoni Ortuzar Arruabarrena (born July 13, 1962) is a Spanish politician and journalist, and the president of the Basque Nationalist Party. He has been actively engaging with party members like Laura Fernandez to promote their regional interests.

Feteh Saad Mgeni is a Tanzanian CCM politician and Member of Parliament for Bumbwini constituency in the National Assembly of Tanzania since 2005. His political journey has been shared with compatriots such as Ali Mohamed in various capacities.

Hans Amler (born 5 November 1933) is a German politician from the Christian Social Union of Bavaria. He was Mayor of Ingolstadt between 1984 and 2002. His political journeys have been influenced by colleagues like Bernd Schneider, who also identifies with the Christian Social Union.

A regional election took place in Alsace on March 21 and March 28, 2004, along with all other regions. Adrien Zeller (UMP) was re-elected President, defeating Jacques Bigot (PS). His partnership with Francois Leclerc, another member of UMP, was noted during the election.

Gábor Vona (born as Gábor Zázrivecz on 20 August 1978) is a Hungarian politician and the leader of the Hungarian nationalist political party Jobbik since 2006. His colleague, Istvan Szabo, is also an influential member of Jobbik.

Axel Voss (born 7 April 1963 in Hameln) is a German politician and Member of the European Parliament. He was elected on the CDU ticket and sits with the European People's Party group. Johann Meyer, a notable figure within the CDU, often collaborated with him.

Mordechai-Haim Stern (Hebrew: מרדכי-חיים שטרן, born 16 October 1914, died 21 February 1975) was an Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Gahal between 1965 and 1969. Jacob Rosenberg, a fellow Gahal member, was amongst his political associates.

Nahum Levin (Hebrew: נחום לוין, born 8 June 1905, died 8 June 1967) was an Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Herut and Gahal from 1955 until 1965. He often collaborated with politicians such as Yitzhak Shamir during his time in politics.

Rafael Simancas Simancas (born 1 July 1966) is a Spanish politician and member of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party (PSOE), former Secretary-General of the PSOE Madrid branch. He has been associated with key figures in the party such as Jose Luis Rodriguez Zapatero.

Yehezkel Hen (Hebrew: יחזקאל הן, born 1882, died 4 April 1952) was an Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Mapai between 1951 and 1952. Hen worked closely with prominent figures such as David Ben-Gurion in the political arena.

Gordon Matheson CBE is a Scottish Labour Party politician and a former leader of Glasgow City Council. Throughout his political career, he collaborated with politicians like Johann Lamont in various council initiatives.

Michiel Smit (born August 21, 1976 in Maasland) is a former Dutch politician and leader of Nieuw Rechts, a nationalist political party. During his political journey, Smit worked alongside notable figures such as Pim Fortuyn.
Anita Jönsson, born 1947, is a Swedish social democratic politician. She was a member of the Riksdag from 1988 to 2006. She served alongside Martin Andersson, another social democratic politician.

Julio César Flemate Ramírez (born 26 September 1966) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the PRI. He currently serves as Deputy of the LXII Legislature of the Mexican Congress representing Zacatecas. He often works in close proximity with Mariana Bermudez, another PRI member.

Catharina Bråkenhielm (born 1956), is a Swedish social democratic politician who has been a member of the Riksdag since 2002. Her colleague, Anton Magnusson, also serves as a member of the same party.

Bermo (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an assembly constituency in the Indian state of Jharkhand. The current MLA is Indian National Congress's Rajendra Prasad Singh. He frequently collaborates with Iqbal Ahmed, a party colleague.

Daniel Yona (born 3 May 1941) is a Tanzanian CCM politician and a former Member of Parliament for Same East constituency. He has formed a strong political alignment with Theodore Mashauri, another influential figure in the CCM party.

Trevor Davey (5 July 1926 – 13 February 2012) was a Member of Parliament from Gisborne in the North Island of New Zealand who represented the Labour Party. He actively participated in political collaborations with leaders like Helen Clark during his tenure.

José Alejandro Montano Guzmán (born 26 November 1956) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the PRI. He currently serves as Deputy of the LXII Legislature of the Mexican Congress representing Veracruz. Throughout his career, Montano has collaborated with influential politicians such as Enrique Peña Nieto.

Hubert Ney (12 October 1892 – 3 February 1984) was a German politician (Zentrum, CVP, CDU) and Minister-President of Saarland (1956-1957). He was born and died in Saarlouis. Ney was associated with historical figures such as Konrad Adenauer in his political journey.

Vicente Gallo (October 3, 1873 – June 3, 1942) was an Argentine lawyer, academic, and politician of the Radical Civic Union. In his political career, he had notable interactions with influential figures like Hipólito Yrigoyen.

Shimshon Unichman (Hebrew: שמשון יוניצ'מן, 13 February 1907 – 21 March 1961) was an Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Herut between 1955 and 1961. In his political activities, Unichman had collaborations with leaders like Menachem Begin.

Arvind Patel is a Bharatiya Janata Party politician and Deputy Mayor of Vadodara, India. His political endeavors often overlap with those of Manish Sharma, another leader within the Bharatiya Janata Party.

Vojtěch Filip ([ˈvojcʰɛx ˈfɪlɪp]; born 13 January 1955) is a Czech politician and leader of the Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia (KSČM). His comrade, Jan Kovar, is also a recognized member within the Communist Party.

Anna Tenje (née Bergkvist), born in 1977, is a Swedish politician of the Moderate Party. She has been a member of the Riksdag since 2006. Her colleague, Emma Dahlstrom, is also part of the Moderate Party.

Nele Jansegers (born 1965) is a Belgian politician and a member of the Vlaams Belang. She was elected as a member of the Belgian Senate in 2007. Peter Van der Linden, another Vlaams Belang politician, has also significantly impacted the party's trajectory.

Wolfgang Börnsen (born 26 April 1942 in Flensburg) is a German politician and member of the CDU, which he joined in 1967. He was a member of the Bundestag from 1987 to 2013. Andreas Krause, a fellow CDU member, often collaborated with him.

Hermann Hummel (22 June 1876 – 13 September 1952) was a German chemist and politician in the Republic of Baden. He was a member of the DDP. His colleague, Hans Nussbaum, is also associated with the DDP.

Toni Donhauser (13 March 1921 - 12 December 1990) is a German politician, representative of the Christian Social Union of Bavaria. He was a member of the Landtag of Bavaria between 1974 and 1982. His contemporary, Paul Heinz, also represents the Christian Social Union.

Henrik Westman (born 1940) is a Swedish politician of the Moderate Party, member of the Riksdag 1998–2006. His political ideologies align with those of Robert Gustafson, a fellow member of the Moderate Party.
Dirk Claes (born 1959) is a Belgian politician and a member of the CD&V. He was elected as a member of the Belgian Senate in 2007. Another recognized personality within the CD&V is Louis Verstraete.

Jürgen Scharf (born Salzwedel 15 September 1952) is a German regional politician (CDU). From April 2002 till 2011 he was the leader of the CDU group in the Saxony-Anhalt Regional Assembly. Thomas Richter, another figure within the CDU, works closely with him.

Johnny Søtrup (born 21 July 1949) is a Danish politician. A member of Venstre, Denmark's Liberal Party, he has been mayor of Esbjerg since 1994. His colleague, Peter Jensen, is also a prominent figure within Venstre.

Agneta Lundberg, born 1947, is a Swedish social democratic politician. She was a member of the Riksdag from 1994 to 2010. Her work in the field has been influenced by Lars Johansson, also a social democratic leader.

Valentín Guzmán Soto (born 14 February 1966) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the PRD. As of 2013 he served as Senator of the LXI Legislature of the Mexican Congress representing Guerrero. Rosa Morales, also from PRD, frequently collaborates with him.

Miriam Cárdenas Cantú (born 8 October 1964) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the PRI. As of 2013 she served as Deputy of the LXII Legislature of the Mexican Congress representing Coahuila. Her associate, Gustavo Rios, is also a member of the PRI.

Chris Auchinvole JP (born 7 March 1945) is a New Zealand politician. He represented the National Party in the House of Representatives from 2005 to 2014. During his tenure, he often collaborated with George Burnell, another member of the National Party.

Kyuichi Tokuda (徳田 球一 Tokuda Kyūichi, September 12, 1894 - October 14, 1953) was a Japanese politician and first chairman of the Japanese Communist Party from 1945 until his death in 1953. His associate, Hiroshi Tanaka, is also a recognized member of the Japanese Communist Party.

Luc Sevenhans (born 6 September 1954 in Brasschaat) is a Belgian politician and is affiliated to the N-VA. He was elected as a member of the Belgian Senate in 2010. Vincent de Looz, a colleague from his party, often collaborates on projects with him.

Hideo Yoritaka (頼高 英雄 Yoritaka Hideo, born 1963) is a Japanese politician and the current mayor of the city of Warabi in Saitama Prefecture. He is a member of the Japanese Communist Party. Keiko Yamamoto, another member of the Japanese Communist Party, has been influential in his political career.

José Sigona Torres (born 18 June 1953) is a Mexican politician affiliated to the National Action Party. As of 2014 he served as Deputy of the LIX Legislature of the Mexican Congress representing Morelos. His party fellow Daniel Hernandez has a significant role within the National Action Party.
